And I think this Court has recognized in numerous cases, in Brignoni-Ponce, in Almeida-Sanchez, and other cases, that the random... this discretion, the unbridled, unconstrained discretion in the hands of the officer in the field is what is very important insofar as the application of the reasonableness standard to the Fourth--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Do you think this is the same rule whether it was three miles from the... two miles from the coast, three miles from the coast, 18 miles from the coast, or 100 miles?
A million?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --Well, I think insofar as three miles from the coast is concerned, Your Honor, that there could have possibly been a border type... a border search rationale applied.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Why?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: Well, I think if it is that close to--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Well, it is close.
It is close.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --I think it can be a matter of degree.
If you are right at the coast, if you are one mile--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: You mean, you have already crossed the border.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --That's correct.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Any time you cross the border, you can search?
You can not only board, you can search the entire vessel?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: Not any time you cross the border, Your Honor, no.
If there--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Why not?
Within three miles, say.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --Well, I'm just... I'm just saying that there's a possibility the Court of Appeal might have found that this... if it had been three miles, or closer to the border, there may have been a border search rationale applied, because--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Let's suppose it wasn't Customs.
The state, the state says, any time you cross our border, you have to be searched.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --No, that would be unreasonable, Your Honor.
That would be unreasonable under the Fourth Amendment.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: Do you think it is unreasonable for a state to put up an inspection station at its border and search for citrus that may cause plant disease in that state?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: No, Your Honor.
Not a permanent check point or an inspection station.
No, I do not think that would be unreasonable.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: I know, but a vessel, it can unload anywhere along the beach, and here is a... here is the state's border, three miles out in the ocean, or nine miles, some places in the Gulf, and the vessel has crossed the border of the state.
You don't know where it's going to tie up.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: Well, Your Honor--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: It may go into some... it may just unload.
It just may anchor 50 yards off the coast and unload.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --That's correct.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Don't you think the state could stop that and insist on a search to see if it is carrying something that is contrary to state law?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: Well, I think... Your Honor, I think that might be unreasonable under the Fourth Amendment.
Certainly, they--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Assume it isn't.
Assume for the minute it isn't.
What is the border of the United States?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --I would say the border of the United States, the coast of the United States, is three miles... there's a--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: What's the border?
What is the outer boundaries of the United States?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --I think it's three miles off the coast, Your Honor, if I'm not mistaken.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Of the United States?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: I think so.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: And what--

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: It's Customs waters.
I think that's referred to Customs waters, if I'm not mistaken.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: --Well, that's... you mean the Customs waters is three miles?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: If I... I think so.
I'm not sure about that point, Your Honor.
It may be 12 miles off the coast.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: A few minutes ago you said it's all right to stop and search for bugs and things.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: At a permanent type check point, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well, suppose while they are looking for it they find marijuana.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: I'm sorry, Your Honor.
I didn't hear you.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Suppose they find marijuana.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: If they find--

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: While they were searching the lettuce.

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --If they find marijuana, then the person is subject to being arrested and prosecuted.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: What's the difference between that case and this one?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: This is a roving patrol, random type search that leaves--

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: That's the only difference?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --Well, the only difference, too, Your Honor, is that it is... it was made pursuant--

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: The only difference, too?

turn.speaker: richard_i_ieyoub
turn.label: Mr. Richard I. Ieyoub
turn.text: --No, Your Honor.
There is also a difference in that it was made pursuant to a federal statute which grants broad powers of search and seizure which are unreasonable under the Fourth Amendment.
This was a random search by a roving patrol, and I think this Court in prior decisions has held that this is unreasonable under the Fourth Amendment.
Thank you.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: --Do you have anything further, Mr. Alito?

section.heading: Rebuttal of Samuel A. Alito Jr.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: Two very brief points, Mr. Chief Justice.
First, if the Court wishes, we will submit a supplemental brief on the issue of whether dismissal of the indictment mooted this case.
Second, I want to emphasize--

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well, on that, will you please put in a copy of your order which the U.S. Attorney filed, the motion to dismiss the indictment?

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: --Yes, Your Honor, we will look into that.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: It is right here in the record.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: Well, Your Honor, as I said, that was done not because they had no further interest in pursuing this case.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well, it doesn't say... it just says he's the one.
If it hadn't been for him, it wouldn't have been done.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: It was done because he wanted to comply with the mandate of the Court of Appeals.
The only other... Thank you.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Do you have anything... Your time is not up.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: I am sorry.

The only other point I would like to add, Mr. Chief Justice, was that the crux of this case is that until a documentation inspection is conducted, it is not possible to know what sort of vessel Customs is dealing with, and that is why it's necessary, and that is illustrated graphically by this particular case.

Here, if the Henry Morgan II had been a documented boat from Basilea, Louisiana, or Mississippi, or Alaska, it would have had exactly the same markings, and here, a Customs patrol in a Louisiana ship channel came across a boat that bore the outward markings of a landlocked country 5,000 miles away.
The hailing port was written in Latin, and although the vessel bore Swiss markings, it was actually of French registry.
Because situations like this come up all the time, it is necessary to conduct a documentation check to determine whether any further procedures, including a full-scale border search, is appropriate.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Well, in your submission, it sounds like, your most recent one, anyway, is that on the facts of this case, this boarding was all right, but that you aren't pushing for any kind of a rule that you can search any... you can board any vessel that you find anchored 18 miles off the coast.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: No, I believe it is necessary to do that, because until you inspect the documents, you cannot--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: So you are saying any vessel you find anchored or under way 18 miles off the coast or any distance off the coast, for that matter, you can stop and make a document check?

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: --We believe the statute is constitutional, and that is what it provides.
I think this case is--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Well, you are not arguing about the search, I don't suppose.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: --Pardon me?

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Are you arguing that the search provision, part of the... is constitutional?

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: That is not the issue here.
All that was conducted here was a document check.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: But I take your argument to be, as applied here, it meets constitutional standards.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: That's correct.
A document check was conducted here, and those are reasonable because they are necessary for enforcing many important national laws.
Thank you.

turn.speaker: lewis_f_powell_jr
turn.label: Justice Lewis F. Powell, Jr.
turn.text: Is the statute limited to Customs waters?

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: No, it is in any part of the United States or in Customs waters.

turn.speaker: lewis_f_powell_jr
turn.label: Justice Lewis F. Powell, Jr.
turn.text: I was thinking about the request or suggestion as to whether or not a search could be made 100 miles off the coast.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: A search could be made 100 miles off the coast by the Coast Guard pursuant to a different statute which authorizes boardings on the high seas of any vessel subject to U.S. jurisdiction for the purpose--

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: There are some cases pending on that, isn't that correct, down in Florida?

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: --There are many cases pending on that issue, and that authority has generally been upheld by Courts of Appeals based upon reasoning analogous to the arguments we have advanced in this case.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Do you have in mind how many times we have denied certiorari on boardings off the Florida coast and--
--Both ways.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: Quite a few.
There have been a number of them.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Both ways.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: That authority has been sustained by at least three or four circuits, and cert has been denied on numerous occasions.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: May I ask one question?
I know it has been asked.
I am a little... not entirely clear on your answer.
Justice Brennan, I believe, asked you, in the Court of Appeals, did you argue that reasonable suspicion was not necessary?

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: We did in our petition for rehearing.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: In your petition for rehearing.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: We did not do it initially because of settled Fifth Circuit authority, and because we had won on alternative grounds in the District Court.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Right.

turn.speaker: samuel_alito_jr
turn.label: Mr. Samuel A. Alito Jr.
turn.text: But we raised it in the petition for rehearing.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Thank you, gentlemen.
The case is submitted.
